Microbiological and anthropogenic chemical pollution is methodically monitored and regulated in drinking water by law. The Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council on the protection of groundwater against pollution and deterioration (2006/118/EC) imposes EU member states to terminate exploitation of water from groundwater wells if active substance of any pesticide, including its relevant metabolites, degradation and reaction products exceeds the 100Â ng/L threshold
77 . Threshold violations have been reported in Italy, the Netherlands, Belgium, Sweden, Finland and Denmark, leading to the closure of many drinking water wells
74 .
